tags: don't mess with Sansa and her Jigglypuff guys
the adventures of the Pokemon crew aka Sansa and Jaime ft Gendry
summary:
*Jaime running past Brienne towards the gate*
Brienne: Where are you going?!
Jaime yelling at Brienne: THERE'S A JIGGLYPUFF BY...
body:
*Jaime running past Brienne towards the gate*
Brienne: Where are you going?!
Jaime yelling at Brienne: THERE'S A JIGGLYPUFF BY THE GATE!!
Sansa running past Brienne towards Jaime
Sansa: BACK OFF YOU ONE-HANDED BITCH! THAT JIGGLYPUFF IS MINE!!
*Arya and Gendry walk up towards Brienne, notices Jaime and Sansa running towards the gate*
Arya: What the fuck is going on here?
Brienne: They're just arguing over something called a Jigglypuff? I-
*Gendry already sprinting towards Sansa and Jaime*
Gendry: WHERE THE FUCK IS THE JIGGLYPUFF!!??
Sansa: STEP OFF BITCH!! JIGGLYPUFF IS MINE!!

dialogue.phrase: *Jaime running past Brienne towards the gate*

dialogue.name: Jaime yelling at Brienne
dialogue.label: Jaime yelling at Brienne:
dialogue.phrase: THERE'S A JIGGLYPUFF BY THE GATE!!
Sansa running past Brienne towards Jaime

dialogue.name: Sansa
dialogue.label: Sansa:
dialogue.phrase: BACK OFF YOU ONE-HANDED BITCH! THAT JIGGLYPUFF IS MINE!!
*Arya and Gendry walk up towards Brienne, notices Jaime and Sansa running towards the gate*

dialogue.name: Arya
dialogue.label: Arya:
dialogue.phrase: What the fuck is going on here?

dialogue.name: Brienne
dialogue.label: Brienne:
dialogue.phrase: They're just arguing over something called a Jigglypuff? I-
*Gendry already sprinting towards Sansa and Jaime*

dialogue.name: Gendry
dialogue.label: Gendry:
dialogue.phrase: WHERE THE FUCK IS THE JIGGLYPUFF!!??

dialogue.name: Sansa
dialogue.label: Sansa:
dialogue.phrase: STEP OFF BITCH!! JIGGLYPUFF IS MINE!!

tags: they dont need a hero they are the hero
summary: Prolly the only good thing about GOT’s finale
caption: Prolly the only good thing about GOT’s finale

reblog.comment: Prolly the only good thing about GOT’s finale

trail.content_raw: Prolly the only good thing about GOT’s finale
trail.content: Prolly the only good thing about GOT’s finale

body:
Detention (the bitchslap) modern au

Brienne learns about jaime’s detention second hand, hell it feels more like thirteenth hand. The “incident” happened at ten am and Brienne only learns about it at 2pm. Not that anyone seemed inclined to tell her, every time she approached a whispering, giggling group everyone suddenly got very busy. That’s not new Brienne isn’t exactly a social butterfly, more like a caterpillar never destined to leave her chrysalis.

She’s not sure why no one wants to tell her what’s going on, their reluctance to tell her makes her think that somehow it’s about her but she can’t think of a possible link between her and Jaime getting detention.

Worry knaws at her stomach, Jaime was a good student but he acted on impulse and easily got into trouble, they were close to graduating and Brienne worries about his record.

In the end she corners Sansa and demands answers (she stutters but it counts because Sansa spills)

Jaime had apparently hit Red Ronnett.

“Why!?” Brienne asks bewildered, Sansa eyes her warily.

“Really?” Sansa asks dubiously , “you can’t think of a reason?”

Brienne searches her memory, they’d been set up on a blind date a million years ago and it hadn’t gone well, she’d been shy and even more self concious and he’d taken one look at her and had…well he had been cruel.

But it was white noise, Brienne could mostly tune it out. Mostly. But that didn’t explain why Jaime had hit him.

“No, I mean, i know jaime has a short fuse but…”

“It’s about you,” Sansa says, as if explaining something to a child. “Ronnett said something about you and Jaime hit him”

“Is Jaime alright?” Brienne asks urgently.

Sansa tilts her head, considering, “a few bruised knuckles and a two day suspension”

Brienne breathes a sigh of relief, now that she knows he is fine she can be angry at him. What was he doing playing chicken with his student record, she knew that the Lannister name protected Jaime from the bulk of his misdeeds but it always forced brienne’s heart into her throat.

Something caught her attention, “why would Jaime care if Ronnett said something about me?” Brienne asks, “he calls me ugly to my face?”

Sansa laughs, it’s not a mean laugh, it’s born of genuine surprise.

“Maybe you should ask Jaime,” Sansa says still chuckling.

Brienne is left even more confused.

summary: Legit don't understand how people can hate any of the main ASOIAF ladies when they're almost all literal minors ??? like Sansa...
body: Legit don’t understand how people can hate any of the main ASOIAF ladies when they’re almost all literal minors ??? like Sansa is thirteen. 13, three and ten, she Just entered her fucking teens. and Daenerys is a whole of sixteen ?? She’s what? ?? a sophomore in high school and has lost a child and SHE WAS FORCIBLY MARRIED AT THIRTEEN (that’s. Sansa’s age. The Fuck). and Arya? She! Is! Eleven! That is one year after ten. One. Year. And y'all act surprised?? When I cut them some fucking slack? They’re traumatized fucking children! GRRM answer for your Crimes and the rest of you hating on teenage and younger girls? Guillotine

summary: What I hate is how Dany stans act like Sansa is responsible for Dany's people betraying her. No, she isn't! Sansa didn't create...
question: What I hate is how Dany stans act like Sansa is responsible for Dany's people betraying her. No, she isn't! Sansa didn't create any cracks or tension in Dany's circle. She simply discovered that those cracks already existed. She told Tyrion about Jon because she saw that Tyrion feared Dany, and his fear had to do with how he ALREADY felt about Dany. She worried him deeply. Dany got betrayed because of how SHE acted. It was HER actions that lost her the full trust of her advisors, NOT Sansa.
answer:
(2) The fact is, Sansa telling Tyrion wouldn’t have ever been an issue for Dany, if she DID have her advisors full support already. Tyrion and Varys would have never allowed that secret to get out at all, if they truly trusted Dany to be a competent ruler. The ONLY reason it became an issue, is because Dany is NOT a ruler they believed in, and Sansa saw through that. Sansa knew she was RIGHT in her suspicions, and Dany stans ignore this obvious piece, in order to blame Sansa for what Dany did.

They don’t want to acknowledge their fave has any flaws. Sansa would have said nothing had she not realised that Tyrion feared Daenerys. Sansa didn’t put that fear in him and she did not give Varys the comparison between Daenerys and Aerys. Daenerys did all of that herself. 

Also Varys didn’t betray Daenerys, he told her that he served the realm and then she became an enemy of the realm. Tyrion saving his brother makes more sense than him being loyal to someone who yells at him at every inconvenience.

summary: Apparently Sansa didn’t even apologize for telling Jon’s secret but apologized bc she couldn’t free him and have him rule the...
question: Apparently Sansa didn’t even apologize for telling Jon’s secret but apologized bc she couldn’t free him and have him rule the north which makes thier whole conversation make sense now. And Jon was right to say that the north is free thanks to her and not him and she should be the one ruling. Really the only smart thing jon said all season
answer: Makes a lot of sense because she said ‘the North lost its king.’ Dunno why they made it vague but I prefer it over Sansa apologising for talking to Tyrion because she did the right thing

reblog.comment: Makes a lot of sense because she said ‘the North lost its king.’ Dunno why they made it vague but I prefer it over Sansa apologising for talking to Tyrion because she did the right thing

summary: In reagrds to your Theon/In GoT's world none beat swords into ploughshares post, one of the only - only - things I liked in the...
question: In reagrds to your Theon/In GoT's world none beat swords into ploughshares post, one of the only - only - things I liked in the later ASOIAF books was the offhanded way we learn that that Hound is living the quiet life in a church some where tending a garden. I think the show had that too but then of course had to make him come back for the Catharsis of A Fight (in which he just dies) and it's so... typical. The one guy who realized you could just walk away wasn't allowed to.
answer:
Gravedigger Sandor Clegane!

I’m with you, as you know. Maybe a counterargument to our position might be that not all ways of meeting violence with violence are completely identical; there is also the option of using violence as a protective measure to prevent further violence from occurring. Of course there are convincing pacifist counter-counterarguments to this as well! But I’m at least willing to entertain the thought that this is a different kind of violence from vengeance.

The twist of the knife in the gut for GoT’s Sandor Clegane storyline, then, is that he is not only written to re-enter the arena of war but that he is specifically written to do it for personal vengeance. “What’s wrong with taking justice into your own hands against someone who abused you and physically harmed you?” one might ask. But again, my point isn’t so much that this is inherently unethical, it’s that the show never makes an effort to imagine any alternatives to this. To consider what a more expansive view of justice might look like. It’s probably not something like restorative justice in this case, because we… can’t get Zombie Mountain together with his victims to work out a way to repair the damage he has caused, but like… it would have been so easy to cast Cleganebowl as a fight to protect rather than damage. We’ve already seen Sandor Clegane engage (in his own way) with the protective valence of force! But no, the only ending GoT can give him is the kind of closure brought about by mutual destruction.

I think about Sansa a lot, and what it means for her skin to turn to steel. If that steel will do other things in the books than what it did on the show; cage Ramsay in with his dogs, slit Littlefinger’s throat in Arya’s hands, circle her brow with the Northern crown. Those are all things I didn’t dislike her doing, but I guess I’ve always wanted her to use that steel to keep the soft things soft! We’ll see.

Gravedigger Sandor Clegane!

I’m with you, as you know. Maybe a counterargument to our position might be that not all ways of meeting violence with violence are completely identical; there is also the option of using violence as a protective measure to prevent further violence from occurring. Of course there are convincing pacifist counter-counterarguments to this as well! But I’m at least willing to entertain the thought that this is a different kind of violence from vengeance.

The twist of the knife in the gut for GoT’s Sandor Clegane storyline, then, is that he is not only written to re-enter the arena of war but that he is specifically written to do it for personal vengeance. “What’s wrong with taking justice into your own hands against someone who abused you and physically harmed you?” one might ask. But again, my point isn’t so much that this is inherently unethical, it’s that the show never makes an effort to imagine any alternatives to this. To consider what a more expansive view of justice might look like. It’s probably not something like restorative justice in this case, because we… can’t get Zombie Mountain together with his victims to work out a way to repair the damage he has caused, but like… it would have been so easy to cast Cleganebowl as a fight to protect rather than damage. We’ve already seen Sandor Clegane engage (in his own way) with the protective valence of force! But no, the only ending GoT can give him is the kind of closure brought about by mutual destruction.

I think about Sansa a lot, and what it means for her skin to turn to steel. If that steel will do other things in the books than what it did on the show; cage Ramsay in with his dogs, slit Littlefinger’s throat in Arya’s hands, circle her brow with the Northern crown. Those are all things I didn’t dislike her doing, but I guess I’ve always wanted her to use that steel to keep the soft things soft! We’ll see.

summary: Join the Game of Thrones: Children of Winter Discord Server!
body:
game of thrones: children of winter

as a discord roleplay for game of thrones set in between episodes 2 and 3 of season 8, this server is welcoming, fun, and very interesting! play as a canon character or even create an oc of your own to interact with the main ones!


join today and have fun! https://discord.gg/kTeBVTB

Hi! The name’s Ace. My blog runs on requests so send them in, but read my rules and fandom list before doing so! Gifs aren't mine. OC information is in my “about” link. Last but not least, this is a safe space for everyone! Be nice to each other and let your imagination soar.

summary: Being in Sansa Stark Queensguard and Falling in Love With Her Would Include...
body:
Being in Sansa Stark Queensguard and Falling in Love With Her Would Include…

•Being incredibly loyal to Sansa and being willing to do anything to protect her

•Falling for her thanks to all the time you spend with her because as a high member of her guard, she constantly needs you to protect her and accompany her to places

•You knowing all too well that your feelings can never lead to anything because you’re unworthy of marrying Sansa so you try to push your love aside, unfortunately it didn’t go away

•People often accusing you of being in love with her or pointing out your affection toward the Queen when they want to get under your skin. They may be right most of the time but you’re always quick to shut them up

  • “I suggest shutting your mouth before I do it for you. The relationship between me and the Queen is none of your concern”

•Trying to impress Sansa when you catch her watching you while you spare

•Blushing like crazy whenever Sansa compliments you in anyway, it usual has to do with your fighting skills

•Having the honour of being one of the very few people that Sansa trusts entirely

•Sansa being no fool and being quite aware of your feelings for her, even if you never say a word about it to her

  • “You realize that that one is completely enthralled with you”
  • “I’m aware, I also know that they’d do anything to keep me safe”

•Sansa not telling you that she knows the truth about how you feel because she doesn’t wish to hurt or embarrass you

•Always being quick to defend Sansa whenever someone tries to question her judgement

•Being hurt a lot on Sansa’s behalf but every wound is worth it as long as your Queen is okay

REQUESTS ARE OPEN

tags: i'll put an anti so that i don't get hate
it's not that i hate daenerys
it's that the stans are ridiculous
and how stupid their complaints about sansa are
summary: So I just spent a considerable bit of time on the Anti-Sansa tag, just to see if I’m wrong, if what Sansa-antis are saying has...
body:
So I just spent a considerable bit of time on the Anti-Sansa tag, just to see if I’m wrong, if what Sansa-antis are saying has any merit. It’s always good to have some skepticism in your beliefs, so I like to look at all sides of an argument. 

I should preface by saying that I do like Daenerys and appreciate her as a complex character. I also acknowledge that there are problematic Sansa stans out there who are very anti as well, just as there are antis in every fandom and for every character. 

That said, I really don’t understand antis problems with Sansa. Like I really don’t. And I have been an Sansa-anti. I mean I was a pre-teen at the time and everything I hated about myself I projected onto her, and it wasn’t until I started studying history and political science and gender norms did I come to see her as an amazing character (also, I grew up and matured). But, I don’t think I would have been that… willfully ignorant(?) about a character. (at least I hope not… goes to show that education is important!)

I mean, she’s just blamed for everything. It really says something about how traditional women are viewed in society. There was that quote (can’t remember who) that said “Women will never know how much they are hated.” Seems very true. Sansa Stark is the most realistic historical woman on the show and she has the most antis. 

This has been exhausting and depressing. I need to go look at uplifting posts now.
